item.title: make ftp working with ssh without changing permissions
item.description: the problem If you want to disable your root user of the maschine being accessed via SSH you probably ran into Problems with SFTP on your server. As long you use the root user of the maschine your SFTP will work fine, but if you change your user you will get into trouble. I’m working a lot with docker and bind mounts for config files so I can’t change the owner/permission of the directory or file I’m binding to.
